statement: Let S be the set {1, 2, 3, …, 1,000,000}. Show that for any subset A of S with 101 elements, we can find 100 distinct elements x1, x2, …, x100 of S such that the sets {a + xi | a ∈ A} are all pairwise disjoint.

Find all pairs (m, n) of positive integers such that

(m^2) / (2mn^2 − n^3 + 1)

is a positive integer.
A convex hexagon has the property that for any pair of opposite sides, the distance between their midpoints is √3/2 times the sum of their lengths. Show that all the angles of the hexagon are equal.

Let ABCD be a cyclic quadrilateral. The feet of the perpendiculars from D to the lines AB, BC, CA are P, Q, R respectively. Show that the angle bisectors of ∠ABC and ∠CDA meet on the line AC if and only if RP = RQ.

Given n > 2 and real numbers x1 ≤ x2 ≤ · · · ≤ xn, show that

(∑_{i,j} |xi − xj|)^2 ≤ (2/3)(n^2 − 1) ∑_{i,j} (xi − xj)^2.

Show that equality holds if and only if the sequence (x1, x2, …, xn) is an arithmetic progression.
Show that for each prime p, there exists a prime q such that n^p − p is not divisible by q for any positive integer n.
